about.label: About the Congress
about.p1: The International Society on Toxinology (IST), founded in 1962, promotes scientific advancement across all areas of toxinology, encompassing venomous and poisonous animals, plants, and microorganisms, derived toxins, envenomation, antivenom development, and the therapeutic and biotechnological applications of toxins. The Society connects researchers worldwide through regular meetings that foster the exchange of ideas, scientific results, and international collaborations.
about.p2Start: In 2026, the 23rd World Congress of the International Society on Toxinology will take place in Manaus, Amazonas. For the first time in the Brazilian Amazon—an area of extraordinary biological diversity and a high incidence of envenomation by venomous animals. Under the theme
about.p2Theme: "Toxinology, Health, and the Amazon: Sharing Experiences across Clinical Practice, Fundamental Research, and Innovation,"
about.p2End: the congress will provide an international forum of academic excellence that is inclusive, diverse, and attentive to ethical considerations.
about.p3: The event will bring together scientists with interests in animal biology, biochemical characterization and mechanisms of action of toxins, pathophysiology of envenomation, development of treatments and novel toxin-based drug candidates, and the integration of basic research, innovation, and clinical practice within a One Health framework.

program.label: Scientific Program
program.item1: Opening Ceremony, including the announcement of the scientist honored with the Redi Award for outstanding contributions to the field, who will deliver the Redi Lecture on a topic of their choice.
program.item2: Four Plenary Lectures delivered by internationally recognized researchers.
program.item3: Sixteen Scientific Sessions, each comprising five presentations: four 20-minute invited lectures, including one Early Career Scientist, and one 10-minute oral presentation selected from submitted abstracts.
program.item4: Two Poster Sessions, scheduled at prime time, with poster presentation and evaluation, eligible for awards.
program.item5: Three Short Courses offered as extracurricular activities.
program.item6: Social and Cultural Activities, including the official congress dinner and immersive experiences highlighting the Amazon's landscape and cultural biodiversity.

committee.label: Scientific Committee
committee.intro: The Scientific Committee brings together experts from different continents, affiliated with leading institutions and active across multiple areas of toxinology, ranging from basic research to clinical and biotechnological applications.

venue.label: Venue
venue.p1: The congress will be held at the Hotel Tropical, in Manaus, a venue that combines infrastructure suitable for large-scale scientific events with direct contact with the Amazonian natural environment. Its privileged location offers an ideal setting for scientific activities while also enabling cultural experiences and opportunities for environmental immersion.

registration.label: Registration
registration.subtitle: Registration for the 23rd World Congress of the International Society on Toxinology will open soon. Detailed information regarding registration fees, registration categories, and the complete schedule will be made available in due course.
registration.p1: Registration categories will include professionals, students, IST members, and non-members, with differentiated fees according to category and registration period (early registration, regular registration, and late/on-site registration).
registration.p2: Information on abstract submission guidelines, including presentation modalities (oral and poster), will also be announced shortly.
